text: Poland at the Olympics is a history which includes 42 games in 22 countries and 2,000+ athletes.SportsReference.com (SR/Olympics), "Poland" ; retrieved 2012-7-28. Since 1918, Poland has contributed to the growth of the "Olympic Movement".Olympics.org, "Factsheet: The Olympic Movement"; retrieved 2012-7-28. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Poland is POL. ==History== The Polish National Olympic Committee was formed in 1918. It was recognized by the International Olympic Committee in 1919.Olympic.org, Poland; retrieved 2012-7-28. Poland's team first competed at the 1924 Summer Olympics in Stockholm. Poland has sent athletes to every Summer Olympic Games since then, except for the 1984 Games. They were a part of the Soviet led boycott of the 1984 Games.
